net.jodah.recurrent

Class RetryPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jodah.recurrent.RetryPolicy

  • public final class RetryPolicy
extends Object
    Policy that defines how retries should be performed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RetryPolicy()
      Creates a retry policy that retries forever with no delay between retries.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allowsRetries()
      Returns whether the policy allows any retries based on the configured maxRetries and maxDuration.
      boolean allowsRetriesFor(Throwable failure)
      Returns whether the policy will allow retries for the failure.
      Duration getDelay()
      Returns the delay between retries.
      double getDelayMultiplier()
      Returns the delay multiplier for backoff retries.
      Duration getMaxDelay()
      Returns the max delay between backoff retries.
      Duration getMaxDuration()
      Returns the max duration to perform retries for.
      int getMaxRetries()
      Returns the max retries.
      RetryPolicy retryOn(Class<? extends Throwable>... failures)
      Specifies the failures to retry on.
      RetryPolicy retryWhen(Predicate<Throwable> retryPredicate)
      Specifies when a retry should occur for a particular failure.
      RetryPolicy withBackoff(long delay, long maxDelay, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Sets the delay between retries, exponentially backing of to the maxDelay and multiplying successive delays by a factor of 2.
      RetryPolicy withBackoff(long delay, long maxDelay, TimeUnit timeUnit, double delayMultiplier)
      Sets the delay between retries, exponentially backing of to the maxDelay and multiplying successive delays by the delayMultiplier.
      RetryPolicy withDelay(long delay, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Sets the delay between retries.
      RetryPolicy withMaxDuration(long maxDuration, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Sets the max duration to perform retries for.
      RetryPolicy withMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
      Sets the max number of retries to perform.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RetryPolicy

        public RetryPolicy()
        Creates a retry policy that retries forever with no delay between retries.

    • Method Detail

      • allowsRetries

        public boolean allowsRetries()
        Returns whether the policy allows any retries based on the configured maxRetries and maxDuration.

      • allowsRetriesFor

        public boolean allowsRetriesFor(Throwable failure)
        Returns whether the policy will allow retries for the failure.

      • getDelay

        public Duration getDelay()
        Returns the delay between retries. Defaults to Duration.NONE.
        See Also:
        #withDelay(Duration), #withBackoff(Duration, Duration), #withBackoff(Duration, Duration, int)

      • getDelayMultiplier

        public double getDelayMultiplier()
        Returns the delay multiplier for backoff retries.
        See Also:
        #withBackoff(Duration, Duration, int)

      • getMaxDelay

        public Duration getMaxDelay()
        Returns the max delay between backoff retries.
        See Also:
        #withBackoff(Duration, Duration)

      • getMaxDuration

        public Duration getMaxDuration()
        Returns the max duration to perform retries for.
        See Also:
        #withMaxDuration(Duration)

      • getMaxRetries

        public int getMaxRetries()
        Returns the max retries. Defaults to -1, which retries forever.
        See Also:
        withMaxRetries(int)

      • retryOn

        public RetryPolicy retryOn(Class<? extends Throwable>... failures)
        Specifies the failures to retry on. Any failure that is assignable from the failures will be retried.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if failures is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if failures is empty

      • retryWhen

        public RetryPolicy retryWhen(Predicate<Throwable> retryPredicate)
        Specifies when a retry should occur for a particular failure. Supercedes retryOn(Class...).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if failurePredicate is null

      • withBackoff

        public RetryPolicy withBackoff(long delay,
                               long maxDelay,
                               TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the delay between retries, exponentially backing of to the maxDelay and multiplying successive delays by a factor of 2.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if delay is <= 0 or delay is >= maxDelay

      • withBackoff

        public RetryPolicy withBackoff(long delay,
                               long maxDelay,
                               TimeUnit timeUnit,
                               double delayMultiplier)
        Sets the delay between retries, exponentially backing of to the maxDelay and multiplying successive delays by the delayMultiplier.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalStateException - if delay is >= the maxDuration
        IllegalArgumentException - if delay <= 0, delay is >= maxDelay, or the delayMultiplier is <= 1

      • withDelay

        public RetryPolicy withDelay(long delay,
                             TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the delay between retries.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if delay <= 0
        IllegalStateException - if delay is >= the maxDuration, or backoff delays have already been set via #withBackoff(Duration, Duration) or #withBackoff(Duration, Duration, int)

      • withMaxDuration

        public RetryPolicy withMaxDuration(long maxDuration,
                                   TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the max duration to perform retries for.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalStateException - if maxDuration is <= the delay

      • withMaxRetries

        public RetryPolicy withMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        Sets the max number of retries to perform. -1 indicates to retry forever.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxRetries < -1
